Dates and TimesÂ¶

The Organization Ontology uses the W3C Time Ontology 1 for representation of dates and times. The key entity is time:Instant, which may have a precision to indicate whether we know the instant to a particular day, moth, year, or with more precision, hour, minute, second, and so on. The Time Ontology has sophisticated semantics for many kinds of calendars. The examples for the Organization Ontology assume Gregorian calendar.

Footnotes

1

https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-time/
